abstract.p: China is unique in its investment strategy over the past 40 years. Its rate of investment was much higher and its investment efficiency much lower than those of Japan and other Asian developing countries. Investment efficiency had experienced little improvement in recent reforms mainly owing to the fact that decentralization of investment had not been accompanied by substantial reforms in prices and enterprise accountability. China is also one of the few countries in the world which not only financed its investment through its own saving but also exported capital during its early industrialization drive. In the past, the government was apprehensive that in the absence of government saving national saving might drop drastically. Recent experience with decentralizing saving proved this to be wrong.
